laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete Blood Count and Electrolytes, Calcium, Creatinine, Urea Nitrogen, Protein, Albumin, Globulin, Bilirubin
CT scan of abdomen and pelvis
laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral hydronephrosis and bilateral solid ovarian masses; right ovary mass measured 4.4 cm by 2.5 cm and left ovary mass measured 5.6 cm by 4.5 cm. Enlarged aortocaval lymph node 1.4 cm.
Posterior bladder mucosa thickened and friable with distorted muscular wall. Histological examination revealed invasive transitional-cell carcinoma, grade 3 with invasion of muscularis propria.
Left adnexal mass 4.2 cm by 4.8 cm with invasion into the uterus; right adnexal mass enhancing but not invading the uterus; thickening of bladder wall.
Infiltrating lobular carcinoma cells that invaded muscularis propria, distinguishing characteristics led to diagnosis of metastatic breast carcinoma.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT scans after 3 months of tamoxifen
laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked shrinkage of the pelvic masses.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported improvement in bladder capacity, disappearance of urgency and incontinence, and decreased nocturia.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT scans after 6 months of tamoxifen
laboratory_examinations.findings: CT scans were unchanged from earlier studies.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient reported complete disappearance of urinary symptoms.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Stable disease without progression, slightly more than three years after beginning treatment.
